title: AFURI Brand Information
content:
「AFURI」という名前は、神奈川県丹沢山系の東端に位置する大山(通称・阿夫利山)に由来。この阿夫利山の麓で得られる清らかな水をスープの仕込み水に用いたことから、「AFURI」と名付けました。
富士山の父にあたる山として、古来から愛され続けてきた阿夫利山。そもそもは“雨降山(あめふりやま)”とも呼ばれ、人々から五穀豊穣の願いを託される神の山でもありました。また、その雄大で凛とした姿は人々を魅了し、江戸時代には年間数十万人もの参拝者が訪れたと言われます。我々「AFURI」も現代の江戸の街・東京で、人々を幸せにする存在でありたいと思っています。
AFURIのらーめんを仕込んでいるのは、神奈川県愛甲郡清川村に構える「セントラルキッチン」。国産の丸鶏、魚介、香味野菜などの厳選された素材を用い、じっくりと時間をかけて炊き上げるスープ。少し沸騰するだけで味も香りも変わってしまうほど繊細なその味は、気候、湿度、火加減、時間のすべてを緻密に計算しつくっています。らーめんの味を司る、特製の塩ダレ・醤油ダレ。チャーシューなども、すべてセントラルキッチンでその日のベストの味を追求したもの。阿夫利山の麓で毎日仕込み、各店舗で丁寧に調理し、お客様に提供しています。
We’re named after a mountain—Mt. AFURI, on the east edge of the Tanzawa mountains in Kanagawa prefecture. Legend has it Afuri is the father of Mt. Fuji.Afuri has long been known for its waters, and in days past, it was considered a sacred mountain of good harvest, and thousands would journey to Mt. Afuri every year in pilgrimage. We like to think we’re bringing sacred Mt. Afuri to the rest of the world. The mountain provides us with a kind of philosophy. It can be a little tricky to translate it literally from Japanese, but let’s just call it “Higher.” We push higher in everything we do—everything, from pickling to serving—and we intend to reach for excellence as long as we are AFURI. Mt. Afuri remains—straight, honest, steadfast, dependable. That’s our aim. One ramen. One staff. Always higher.
AFURI ramen is different from ramen you’ve had elsewhere. It’s lighter, refreshing—even a little delicate. We’re particular about all our ingredients—but there’s one ingredient in particular that makes AFURI ramen special. We make our signature ramen with yuzu, a small yellow citrus fruit native to Asia. We splash it in our fresh chicken broth and we garnish it on top, too. It adds a touch of freshness to our ramen and pairs perfectly with our broth and charcoal-grilled pork. We think of it as a thoughtful, refreshing update on everything that makes ramen so great.
Copyright © AFURI. All rights reserved.
「AFURI」という名前は、神奈川県丹沢山系の東端に位置する大山(通称・阿夫利山)に由来。この阿夫利山の麓で得られる清らかな水をスープの仕込み水に用いたことから、「AFURI」と名付けました。

富士山の父にあたる山として、古来から愛され続けてきた阿夫利山。そもそもは“雨降山(あめふりやま)”とも呼ばれ、人々から五穀豊穣の願いを託される神の山でもありました。また、その雄大で凛とした姿は人々を魅了し、江戸時代には年間数十万人もの参拝者が訪れたと言われます。我々「AFURI」も現代の江戸の街・東京で、人々を幸せにする存在でありたいと思っています。

AFURIのらーめんを仕込んでいるのは、神奈川県愛甲郡清川村に構える「セントラルキッチン」。国産の丸鶏、魚介、香味野菜などの厳選された素材を用い、じっくりと時間をかけて炊き上げるスープ。少し沸騰するだけで味も香りも変わってしまうほど繊細なその味は、気候、湿度、火加減、時間のすべてを緻密に計算しつくっています。らーめんの味を司る、特製の塩ダレ・醤油ダレ。チャーシューなども、すべてセントラルキッチンでその日のベストの味を追求したもの。阿夫利山の麓で毎日仕込み、各店舗で丁寧に調理し、お客様に提供しています。

Higher
We’re named after a mountain—Mt. AFURI, on the east edge of the Tanzawa mountains in Kanagawa prefecture. Legend has it Afuri is the father of Mt. Fuji.Afuri has long been known for its waters, and in days past, it was considered a sacred mountain of good harvest, and thousands would journey to Mt. Afuri every year in pilgrimage. We like to think we’re bringing sacred Mt. Afuri to the rest of the world. The mountain provides us with a kind of philosophy. It can be a little tricky to translate it literally from Japanese, but let’s just call it “Higher.” We push higher in everything we do—everything, from pickling to serving—and we intend to reach for excellence as long as we are AFURI. Mt. Afuri remains—straight, honest, steadfast, dependable. That’s our aim. One ramen. One staff. Always higher.
Our Ramen
AFURI ramen is different from ramen you’ve had elsewhere. It’s lighter, refreshing—even a little delicate. We’re particular about all our ingredients—but there’s one ingredient in particular that makes AFURI ramen special. We make our signature ramen with yuzu, a small yellow citrus fruit native to Asia. We splash it in our fresh chicken broth and we garnish it on top, too. It adds a touch of freshness to our ramen and pairs perfectly with our broth and charcoal-grilled pork. We think of it as a thoughtful, refreshing update on everything that makes ramen so great.

「AFURI」という名前は、神奈川県丹沢山系の東端に位置する大山(通称・阿夫利山)に由来。この阿夫利山の麓で得られる清らかな水をスープの仕込み水に用いたことから、「AFURI」と名付けました。

富士山の父にあたる山として、古来から愛され続けてきた阿夫利山。そもそもは“雨降山(あめふりやま)”とも呼ばれ、人々から五穀豊穣の願いを託される神の山でもありました。また、その雄大で凛とした姿は人々を魅了し、江戸時代には年間数十万人もの参拝者が訪れたと言われます。我々「AFURI」も現代の江戸の街・東京で、人々を幸せにする存在でありたいと思っています。

AFURIのらーめんを仕込んでいるのは、神奈川県愛甲郡清川村に構える「セントラルキッチン」。国産の丸鶏、魚介、香味野菜などの厳選された素材を用い、じっくりと時間をかけて炊き上げるスープ。少し沸騰するだけで味も香りも変わってしまうほど繊細なその味は、気候、湿度、火加減、時間のすべてを緻密に計算しつくっています。らーめんの味を司る、特製の塩ダレ・醤油ダレ。チャーシューなども、すべてセントラルキッチンでその日のベストの味を追求したもの。阿夫利山の麓で毎日仕込み、各店舗で丁寧に調理し、お客様に提供しています。

Higher
We’re named after a mountain—Mt. AFURI, on the east edge of the Tanzawa mountains in Kanagawa prefecture. Legend has it Afuri is the father of Mt. Fuji.Afuri has long been known for its waters, and in days past, it was considered a sacred mountain of good harvest, and thousands would journey to Mt. Afuri every year in pilgrimage. We like to think we’re bringing sacred Mt. Afuri to the rest of the world. The mountain provides us with a kind of philosophy. It can be a little tricky to translate it literally from Japanese, but let’s just call it “Higher.” We push higher in everything we do—everything, from pickling to serving—and we intend to reach for excellence as long as we are AFURI. Mt. Afuri remains—straight, honest, steadfast, dependable. That’s our aim. One ramen. One staff. Always higher.
Our Ramen
AFURI ramen is different from ramen you’ve had elsewhere. It’s lighter, refreshing—even a little delicate. We’re particular about all our ingredients—but there’s one ingredient in particular that makes AFURI ramen special. We make our signature ramen with yuzu, a small yellow citrus fruit native to Asia. We splash it in our fresh chicken broth and we garnish it on top, too. It adds a touch of freshness to our ramen and pairs perfectly with our broth and charcoal-grilled pork. We think of it as a thoughtful, refreshing update on everything that makes ramen so great.

title: [Compare] Yuzu salt/Yuzu soy sauce ramen (3 servings)
content:
AFURI's two representative ramens, "Yuzu Shio Ramen" and "Yuzu Shoyu Ramen". This set allows you to compare these two types in your favorite combination. It is especially recommended for first-time customers! [Whole wheat extra-thin noodles] 2 servings of Yuzu salt ramen + 1 serving of Yuzu soy sauce ramen [Vacuum hand-kneaded noodles] 1 serving of Yuzu salt ramen + 2 servings of Yuzu soy sauce ramen You can choose any combination you like. For product details on Yuzu Shio Ramen and Yuzu Soy Sauce Ramen, please check the respective pages.・Yuzu salt ramen・Yuzu soy sauce ramen All of these products are made with the goal of recreating the taste of the restaurant at home. Try them all and compare them to find your favorite.
As with AFURI physical stores, customers can choose from two types of noodles: "extra thin noodles made with whole wheat flour" and "vacuum hand-kneaded noodles."
Extra thin whole wheat noodles : The original recipe is based on wheat flour, which has strong elasticity and stickiness and is resistant to stretching when boiled, and two types of whole wheat flour with different grain sizes, plus rye. Homemade noodles made using a No. 24 cutting blade.
Vacuum hand-kneaded noodles : In addition to two types of domestic wheat with different characteristics, nutritious whole wheat flour is mixed and kneaded in a vacuum mixer, then hand-kneaded to give it a smooth and chewy texture.
*Image is for illustrative purposes only. Contents: Homemade extra-thin whole wheat noodles (approx. 130g) × 3 balls Or vacuum hand-kneaded noodles (approximately 155g) × 3 balls・Salted chicken and seafood soup (approx. 360cc) Or soy sauce chicken and seafood soup (approx. 360cc) x 3 servings total, Kochi Prefecture freshly squeezed yuzu juice 5cc x 3 bottles, large roasted pork 1 piece x 3 bags, bamboo shoots approx. 20g x 3 bags, special nori seaweed 3 pieces x 1 bag ▼Best before date: When stored frozen (below -18°C), the expiration date is from the date of manufacture. After thawing for 180 days, consume on the same day. ▼Storage method: Refrigeration required ▼Allergies: Eggs, wheat, pork, chicken, soybeans, mackerel, apples ▼Nutritional information (per serving) Energy 622kcal Protein 20.1g Fat 23.9g Carbohydrates 77.2g Salt equivalent: 6.8g Energy 635kcal Protein 21.1g Fat 23.8g Carbohydrates 79.6g Salt equivalent: 5.7g ▼Others: If purchasing as a gift, please specify the delivery date and time. ・We can provide simple "inner wrapping" services. title: Homemade seasoned egg kit, 1 bag
content:
This is a dream kit that lets you easily make AFURI Seasoned Eggs at home.
Seasoned eggs We have included one zip bag of sauce so that you can cook 5 eggs. You can use eggs on sale at the supermarket, or special eggs where the yolk can be picked up with chopsticks. Whatever kind of eggs you use, we will turn them into AFURI seasoned eggs.
Combined with the ramen and tsukemen meal kits (sold separately), this magical item will take you one step closer to "perfectly recreating AFURI at home." Please give it a try.
*Eggs are not included in this product.

▼How to make seasoned eggs (delicious recipe included) 1. Thaw the sauce pack under running water (it's quicker if you knead it). 2) Place 5 raw eggs in a pot and add enough water to cover the eggs. 3. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to medium and simmer for 6.5 to 7 minutes. 4After 7 minutes, discard the hot water and immediately cool under running water. 5 Peel the egg shells. 6 Gently place the boiled eggs into the sauce packet, which has been thawed in advance. 7. Close the zipper tightly, store it upright in the refrigerator, and let it sit for 24 hours and it's done! ▼Tips for making it easier to peel the shell: 1. Before boiling, poke a hole in the bottom of the egg (the gently curved side) with a thumbtack or pin. After boiling, cool quickly using ice water.

title: Double the duck! [Pre-order sale/November 22nd to December 1st] New Year's Eve ramen and yuzu salt ozoni set
content:
[Please be sure to check! ] *This product cannot be purchased with other products (except for the optional "All-purpose spicy miso", "Meat platter", and "Meat platter DX"). * [Pre-order sales / November 22nd to December 1st] The New Year's Eve Ramen and Yuzu Salt Ozoni Set will begin shipping from December 19th.
For those who want to spend quality time with AFURI on New Year's Eve and New Year's Day.
A special New Year's ramen that tastes like soba noodles, made with AFURI's proud clear chicken soup, a refreshing soy sauce sauce, and rich duck oil. The topping is roast duck, which is made by carefully preparing duck meat, seasoning it only with seaweed salt and black pepper, and then grilling and cooking at low temperature in a vacuum. It is also garnished with grilled green onions, which have become sweeter as the weather gets colder, and are grilled to give them a fragrant finish.
If you like, sprinkle the dried yuzu peel that comes with the package on top before serving. If you like spicy food, we also recommend the optional "All-Purpose Spicy Miso (Yuzu Spicy Red Sauce)."
You can choose from two types of noodles: "Extra thin noodles with whole wheat flour" and "Extra thin noodles with Japanese pepper." The staff recommends the latter, with Japanese pepper. It tastes even more like soba noodles. If you choose "Mix," you will receive two servings of each.
Yuzu Shio Ozoni The soup is made with dashi stock made from bonito flakes, grilled flying fish flakes, kelp, etc., and is finished with refreshing freshly squeezed yuzu juice and yuzu peel. Please enjoy with the cute red and white shiratama mochi and hanafu. Like the ramen, this is a handmade product that does not contain any chemical seasonings, preservatives, or colorings.

*The photo is for illustrative purposes only. Please prepare the condiments such as green onions and mitsuba separately.

title: Yuzu salt ramen (3 servings)
content:
AFURI's signature dish is the "Yuzu Shio Ramen," which features a golden-colored soup. Carefully selected ingredients such as fresh chicken bones, whole chicken, aromatic vegetables, kelp, and dried sardines are simmered in pure, soft water that is perfect for preparation. The special salt sauce is a blend of seasonings such as Guérande salt from Brittany, France, seaweed salt from the Seto Inland Sea, and white tamari brewed in wooden barrels and naturally fermented. The soup, which combines these ingredients to create a deep umami flavor, is finished off with fragrant freshly squeezed yuzu juice from Kochi Prefecture.
As with AFURI physical stores, customers can choose from two types of noodles: "extra thin noodles made with whole wheat flour" and "vacuum hand-kneaded noodles."
Extra thin whole wheat noodles : The original recipe is based on wheat flour, which has strong elasticity and stickiness and is resistant to stretching when boiled, and two types of whole wheat flour with different grain sizes, plus rye. Homemade noodles made using a No. 24 cutting blade.
Vacuum hand-kneaded noodles : In addition to two types of domestic wheat with different characteristics, nutritious whole wheat flour is mixed and kneaded in a vacuum mixer, then hand-kneaded to give it a smooth and chewy texture.
The ingredients include thick and juicy roasted pork, specially made bamboo shoots (thinly sliced bamboo shoots simmered in a sweet and spicy sauce), and premium nori sheets. You can also add mizuna (potherb mustard greens) or boiled eggs to taste.
*Image is for illustrative purposes only.
Contents: 3 servings of homemade extra-thin whole wheat noodles (approx. 130g) or 3 servings of vacuum-kneaded noodles (approx. 155g), 3 servings of chicken and seafood soup (approx. 360cc), 3 bottles of freshly squeezed yuzu juice from Kochi Prefecture (5cc), 3 bags of large-sized roasted pork fillets, 3 bags of bamboo shoots (approx. 20g), 1 bag of premium nori (seaweed) (3 sheets)

title: Yuzuro Tsukemen (3 servings)
content:
This soup stock is made using an abundance of carefully selected ingredients, such as fresh chicken bones, aromatic vegetables, kelp, dried sardines, and dried fish (bonito flakes, dried round mullet flakes, dried mackerel flakes, etc.), and is carefully made over a long period of time and effort to condense the flavor. The AFURI-original dipping sauce is made with three types of sharp soy sauce, fish sauce, black vinegar, flavored oil, etc. to create a rich, appetizing flavor. The AFURI style is to add fragrant freshly squeezed yuzu juice from Kochi Prefecture and serve it cold (both the noodles and the dipping sauce are cold).
The noodles are made from two different types of domestic wheat with different characteristics, as well as nutritious whole wheat flour. They are kneaded in a vacuum mixer and then kneaded by hand, making them the same "vacuum hand-kneaded noodles" that are served in stores.
The ingredients are the same as those in the restaurant, including plenty of juicy braised pork, specially made bamboo shoots (thinly sliced bamboo shoots simmered in a sweet and spicy sauce), and extra-finely chopped nori seaweed. You can also add mizuna (potherb mustard greens) or boiled eggs to taste.
*Image is for illustrative purposes only.

This will go faster if you rub it lightly halfway through. 2 Heat the braised pork and bamboo shoots in a hot water bath for about 3 minutes. (You can also transfer them to a container and use the microwave.) 3 Boil the noodles in plenty of water. ※On high heat. 4 minutes 30 seconds to 5 minutes 30 seconds 4. Pour the dipping sauce into a bowl and add 1 teaspoon each of the toppings and yuzu juice. 5. Rinse the noodles under running water to remove any slime and drain. 6 Place the noodles and ingredients in a bowl and it's done! In addition to the ingredients that come with it, we also recommend mizuna, boiled eggs, and chopped green onions. Heat the dipping sauce made in step 1 in a boiling water bath for about 5 minutes. In step 3, set the boiling time for the noodles. After boiling for 4 to 4.5 minutes , Rinse under running water to remove any slime, then return to the boiling water and heat for 10 seconds before serving. *If you sprinkle a little vegetable oil that you have at home on the noodles, they will not stick together easily.

title: Yuzu Karakuri Ramen (3 servings)
content:
Spicy level 4 (0-8)
AFURI proposes a new concept of "Tasty, spicy and sour." Karakurenai's signature product has arrived.
AFURI's proud chicken clear soup is seasoned with a rich, umami-filled white soy sauce, and the dish expresses a deep spiciness with different characteristics of spiciness, such as several types of chili powder, fresh chili puree, and aromatic chili oil. For the sourness of "Tasty Spicy Sour", freshly squeezed yuzu juice from Kochi Prefecture is used.
The noodles are the same as in the actual store . "Extra thin noodles with Japanese pepper" "
"With Japanese pepper" You can choose from two types: "Vacuum Hand-Kneaded Noodles" and "Vacuum Hand-Kneaded Noodles". Extra-thin noodles with "Japanese pepper": The noodles are made from wheat flour, which has a strong elasticity and stickiness and is resistant to stretching when boiled, and are cut into very thin noodles using No. 24 milling, with the addition of Hana Sansho and Japanese Sansho pepper. You can enjoy the refreshing aroma and tingling sensation of Sansho pepper as you slurp.
"With Japanese pepper" Vacuum hand-kneaded noodles: Two types of domestic wheat with different characteristics are mixed with durum flour and kneaded in a vacuum mixer. The special noodles are hand-kneaded with added Hana Sansho and Japanese Sansho pepper, giving them a refreshing tangy flavor and a smooth, chewy texture.
The ingredients, such as the soft and tender pork slices full of collagen and the crunchy bamboo shoots seasoned with dashi, are carefully prepared to decorate the bowl. Add spring onions, mizuna (cilantro also goes well with this dish), boiled eggs, etc. to taste.
The spiciness level is about level 4 on the restaurant's level scale (0-8). If you add the extra hot chili oil that comes with the ramen, you can adjust the spiciness to level 5-6.
*The image is for illustrative purposes only. (The product does not include boiled eggs or vegetables.)

→ Added " Spicyness Adjustment Kit (with extras) " sold separately!!

▼How to eat (delicious recipe included) (Preparation) Fill a bowl with boiling water to warm it up. Thaw the yuzu juice in advance under running water or in the refrigerator, then float it in the water to warm it up. 1. Boil plenty of water in a pot and heat the soup pack for about 10 minutes, the roast pork pack for 5 minutes, and the bamboo shoots for about 1 minute. 2 In another pot, bring plenty of water to a boil and add the noodles. Once the noodles have naturally loosened, use chopsticks to spread them apart and continue to boil on high heat for 1 to 1.5 minutes (2.5 to 3 minutes for vacuum-kneaded noodles with Japanese pepper) until cooked to your desired firmness. 3 Discard the water from the bowl and add 1 tablespoon (about 6g) of spicy red powder, then pour in the soup heated in 1 and mix. Next, drain the boiled noodles thoroughly using a colander with a handle and place them in a bowl. 4 After arranging the noodles with chopsticks, top with the ingredients you heated in step 2. Shake the heated yuzu juice well and pour in one bottle (15cc). Finally, add some spicy chili oil to taste and it's done. In addition to the ingredients that come with it, other recommended toppings include mizuna, coriander, shredded green onions, green onions, and boiled eggs.

title: 3 bags of charred pork (approx. 360g)
content:
<Scorched Hajikko Char Siu>
The roasted pork is a symbol of AFURI. The offcuts (the parts that cannot be roasted) that are generated during the preparation process are cut into large chunks and cooked in a special seasoning of rich soy sauce and garlic, until scorched and fragrant.
This addictive taste is perfect as a companion to alcoholic drinks!! And if you serve it in a rice bowl like in the reference photo and top it with grated daikon radish and yuzu ponzu sauce... you can make your own original rice similar to the popular "Aburi Koro Char Siu Rice" that is also popular in our stores.
This is a great value barbecued pork dish because it uses leftover material. However, the amount we can prepare each day is limited, so please forgive us if it is sold out. ▼Contents: 3 bags of charred pork (approx. 360g) 120g x 3 bags

title: Yuzu salt soba noodles (4 servings)
content:
The most requested noodle on the online shopping site! Finally a regular product!
The fragrant noodles kneaded with yuzu puree are homemade flat noodles with an irresistible chewy texture! This is a special soupless noodle [available only online] that is served with AFURI's proud salt sauce, mellow fragrant oil, and freshly squeezed yuzu juice. This is a hearty soba noodle dish that also contains a generous 70g (per serving) of chunky braised pork.
It's simple, yet surprisingly rich in flavor and absolutely delicious! After you finish the noodles, you can add more rice to the sauce for a double delicious taste! Please enjoy our mail-order-only "Yuzu Shio-ae Soba" that you can't get at the store. It tastes even better if you add aromatic vegetables such as green onions and shiso leaves in addition to the toppings that come with it. ▼Contents・Homemade flat noodles (approx. 180g) x 4 servings・Specially made braised pork (approx. 70g) x 4 bags・Salt sauce (30cc ) x 4 bottles・Fragrant oil (30cc) x 4 bottles・Freshly squeezed yuzu juice from Kochi Prefecture (5cc) x 4 bottles・Special seasoning (approx. 10g) x 2 bags・4 bags of extra-fine shredded seaweed
▼Best before date If stored frozen (below -18°C), the expiration date is 180 days from the date of manufacture. Once thawed, consume on the same day.
▼Storage method: Refrigeration required
▼Allergies: Eggs, wheat, pork, chicken, soybeans, mackerel, apples
AFURI's ramen and tsukemen are free of artificial seasonings, synthetic colorings, and preservatives.

▼How to Enjoy 1 Thaw the yuzu juice in the refrigerator or under running water beforehand. 2 Thaw the salt sauce, flavored oil, and braised pork in boiling water. 3. Boil the noodles in plenty of boiling water ( 8 minutes ). 4. Drain the boiled noodles and rinse them under running water to remove the slime and tighten the noodles. *You can enjoy this product without having to rinse it in water and then reheat it in the microwave. 5 Transfer the noodles to a bowl, cover with plastic wrap and heat for 1 minute 20 seconds (600W ). 6Add salt sauce ( about 2/3 of it ), flavored oil, and yuzu juice to the warm noodles and mix well. *Do not use the entire salt sauce, only use about two-thirds of the bottle. Use the remaining amount as desired with your final dish of rice. 7 Arrange the braised pork and other ingredients on top, sprinkle on toppings and chopped seaweed, and you're done! We also recommend topping it with spring onions, shiso leaves, coriander, etc., if you like! ★Add extra rice for twice the deliciousness! ★ After you've finished eating the noodles, add the salt sauce from step 6 to the sauce left in the bowl, add a moderate amount of rice, mix well, and enjoy!

title: Yuzu salt hotpot kit (with ramen)
content:
The ramen shop's serious hot pot set is back! The soup now contains significantly more seafood than before! It's even more delicious with a stronger dashi flavor.
This chicken and seafood soup is made by combining AFURI's proud chicken clear broth with a large amount of seafood (dried sardines, bonito flakes, grilled flying fish, kelp, etc.) and seasoning it with a special salt sauce. By adding fragrant freshly squeezed yuzu juice from Kochi Prefecture, an elegant aroma is created, allowing you to enjoy a luxurious yuzu salt hot pot. The special chicken meatballs are made with fresh ground chicken and cartilage, and are kneaded with plenty of ginger, which will warm you right up.
You can also add your favorite ingredients such as seasonal vegetables, seafood, pork, and chicken to create your own original yuzu salt hot pot. Of course, you can finish off your hot pot with yuzu salt ramen. We provide convenient individually wrapped noodles for your convenience.
*The photo is for illustrative purposes only. Please prepare your favorite ingredients. *1 packet of soup for 1-2 servings / 2 packets of soup for 3-4 servings
Contents: 4 packs of chicken and seafood soup (515g), 4 bottles of salt sauce for adjusting flavor (15g), 4 bottles of freshly squeezed yuzu juice from Kochi Prefecture (15cc), 4 packs of special chicken meatballs (4 pieces), 4 bowls of homemade noodles (130g)
▼Best before date If stored frozen (below -18°C), the expiration date is 180 days from the date of manufacture. Once thawed, consume on the same day.
▼Storage method: Refrigeration required

It goes well with a wide range of ingredients, including Chinese cabbage, chrysanthemum, mizuna, shiitake mushrooms, shimeji mushrooms, enoki mushrooms, pork belly (for shabu-shabu), chicken thighs, shirataki, and green onions. It also goes well with a wide range of other ingredients, including seasonal vegetables, seafood, and fish paste.
▼How to eat (delicious recipe included) 1 serving (double the amount for 2-3 servings) 1 Heat one packet of chicken and seafood soup in a hot water bath or similar and dissolve it in advance. Do the same with one bottle of yuzu juice. Also, cut up the prepared ingredients (meat, seafood, vegetables, etc.) into even pieces. 2 Add the chicken and seafood soup to the pot. If you are having this ramen as a final dish, leave about 100g aside for later. 3. Add the prepared ingredients and 4 chicken meatballs to a pot and heat. 4 Once it starts to boil and the ingredients are cooked, pour the yuzu juice (from one citrus fruit) over the entire pot and it's done. Enjoy! Add the soup that you left over from step 2 of the final ramen to the pot. If the amount of soup seems small, add hot water until the noodles are swimming in it. Turn the heat to high, and when the pot is boiling, add one frozen ball of noodles and cover. When steam starts to rise, remove the lid and adjust the heat to boil for 1.5 to 2 minutes (4 to 4.5 minutes for medium-thick noodles) until the noodles are cooked to your desired firmness. After that, adjust the flavor with the included flavor adjustment sauce, and finish by adding yuzu juice to create an even more fragrant ramen. ※One extra step※ You can either parboil the noodles before using, or thaw them in the refrigerator and rinse them under running water before adding them to the pot, allowing you to finish the soup without thickening it. You can also make your own porridge with the soup left over after the ramen. I recommend adding green onions and mitsuba and topping it off with beaten eggs. Please give it a try.

▼How to eat 1 Grilled pork (1 piece x 3 bags) 2 pieces of braised pork (70g x 3 bags) 3. Fatty pork (60g x 3 bags) 4. Scorched Hajikko Char Siu (120g x 3 bags) For the above four items, place them in a hot water bath or container, cover with plastic wrap, and then heat them in the microwave before eating. The center of the braised pork fillet/scorched pork fillet tends to remain cold, so it's easier to warm them up if you break them apart halfway through. Also, please note that if you heat them too much, the meat will shrink and become hard. If you like, you can enjoy them with the included "Char Siu Sauce for Adjusting Flavor." 5. Chicken char siu (1 piece x 2 bags) It is cooked at low temperature in a vacuum oven to keep it moist. Thaw it in the refrigerator, or if you are in a hurry, defrost it under running water, then slice thinly with a sharp knife and enjoy. *If you want to warm it up, we recommend basting it in hot water at about 50-60°C.

title: Free combination! Ni-mi Nabe Kit (with ramen for finishing)
content:
The ramen shop's serious hot pot set is back! Compared to last year, the soup contains significantly more seafood ingredients! The soup has a stronger flavor and is even more delicious.
This product allows you to choose two of the three popular types: Yuzu salt hotpot, Yuzu soy sauce hotpot, and Yuzu spicy red hotpot.
◯Yuzu salt hotpot This chicken and seafood soup is made by combining AFURI's proud chicken clear broth with a large amount of seafood (dried sardines, bonito flakes, grilled flying fish, kelp, etc.) and seasoning it with a special salt sauce. By adding fragrant freshly squeezed yuzu juice from Kochi Prefecture, an elegant aroma is created, allowing you to enjoy a luxurious yuzu salt hot pot. ◯Yuzu soy sauce hotpot As with the Yuzu Shio Nabe, the soup is made from a combination of chicken clear broth and seafood stock. It is made with multiple soy sauces, such as re-brewed soy sauce and tamari soy sauce, and a secret ingredient of fish sauce, making it a soy sauce flavor that matches any ingredients. It also goes great with freshly squeezed yuzu juice from Kochi Prefecture, so you can enjoy a blissful hot pot time with your favorite ingredients.
◯ The yuzu spicy red hotpot soup is the same as the yuzu salt/yuzu soy sauce. The seasoning is a special white soy sauce sauce, and the spiciness is expressed with depth by using different types of chili powder, fresh chili puree, and aromatic chili oil. It goes well with various ingredients, but it is especially good with pork belly (for shabu-shabu), seafood in general, chives, bean sprouts, and coriander.

title: All-purpose spicy miso (Yuzu spicy red sauce)
content:
One of the sources of spiciness in Karakurenai Ramen is the all-purpose spicy miso known as Yuzu Karakurenaijan.
It is not only spicy, but also sweet, bitter, and umami from miso and garlic, and is matured with the flavor of yuzu. It can be used to add spiciness to ramen, as well as gyoza, stir-fried vegetables, grilled meat, miso soup, cup noodles, and many other things. It is also perfect as a spiciness for our popular hot pot products (Yuzu Shio Hot Pot/Spicy Red Hot Pot Kit)! It comes in a generous 100g pack.

title: Yuzu salt ramen (6 servings)
content:
AFURI's signature dish is the "Yuzu Shio Ramen," which features a golden-colored soup. Carefully selected ingredients such as fresh chicken bones, whole chicken, aromatic vegetables, kelp, and dried sardines are simmered in pure, soft water that is perfect for preparation. The special salt sauce is a blend of seasonings such as Guérande salt from Brittany, France, seaweed salt from the Seto Inland Sea, and white tamari brewed in wooden barrels and naturally fermented. The soup, which combines these ingredients to create a deep umami flavor, is finished off with fragrant freshly squeezed yuzu juice from Kochi Prefecture.
As with AFURI physical stores, customers can choose from two types of noodles: "extra thin noodles made with whole wheat flour" and "vacuum hand-kneaded noodles."
Extra thin whole wheat noodles : The original recipe is based on wheat flour, which has strong elasticity and stickiness and is resistant to stretching when boiled, and two types of whole wheat flour with different grain sizes, plus rye. Homemade noodles made using a No. 24 cutting blade.
Vacuum hand-kneaded noodles : In addition to two types of domestic wheat with different characteristics, nutritious whole wheat flour is mixed and kneaded in a vacuum mixer, then hand-kneaded to give it a smooth and chewy texture.
*If you select "Mix," we will provide you with 3 servings of each of the two types of noodles mentioned above.
The ingredients include thick and juicy roasted pork, specially made bamboo shoots (thinly sliced bamboo shoots simmered in a sweet and spicy sauce), and premium nori sheets. You can also add mizuna (potherb mustard greens) or boiled eggs to taste.
*50 yen cheaper per meal than the 3-meal pack. *Image is for illustrative purposes only.
Contents: 6 servings of homemade extra-thin whole wheat noodles (approx. 130g) or 6 servings of vacuum-kneaded noodles (approx. 155g), 6 servings of chicken and seafood soup (approx. 360cc), 6 bottles of freshly squeezed yuzu juice from Kochi Prefecture (5cc), 6 large-sized roasted pork slices (1 slice), 6 bags of bamboo shoots (approx. 20g), 2 bags of premium nori (3 sheets)

▼How to eat (delicious recipe included) 1. Boil plenty of water in a pot and heat the soup pack for 10 minutes and the ingredient pack for 1 minute. 2 In another pot, bring plenty of water to a boil and add the noodles. Once the noodles have naturally loosened, use chopsticks to spread them apart and continue to boil on high heat for 1 to 1.5 minutes (2.5 to 3 minutes for vacuum-kneaded noodles) until they are cooked to your desired firmness. 3) Pour the soup into a pre-heated bowl. 4 Drain the boiled noodles thoroughly using a colander with a handle. 5. Place the noodles in the soup and arrange them with chopsticks, then pour 1 teaspoon of yuzu juice over them. 6Once you've finished arranging the ingredients, it's done! *In addition to the ingredients provided, we also recommend boiled eggs, mizuna, and green onions.

It is made with high-quality dashi, white soy sauce with a sweet taste derived from wheat, and fragrant chicken oil. title: Kararo Tsukemen (3 servings)
content:
This soup stock is made using an abundance of carefully selected ingredients, such as fresh chicken bones, aromatic vegetables, kelp, dried sardines, and dried fish (bonito flakes, dried round mullet flakes, dried mackerel flakes, etc.), and is carefully made over a long period of time and effort to condense the flavor. The AFURI-original dipping sauce is made with three types of sharp soy sauce, fish sauce, black vinegar, and aromatic oils to create a rich, appetizing flavor. The AFURI style is to add homemade chili oil made with fragrant sesame oil and serve it cold (both the noodles and the dipping sauce are cold).
The noodles are made from two different types of domestic wheat with different characteristics, as well as nutritious whole wheat flour. They are kneaded in a vacuum mixer and then kneaded by hand, making them the same "vacuum hand-kneaded noodles" that are served in stores.
The ingredients are the same as those in the restaurant, including plenty of juicy braised pork, specially made bamboo shoots (thinly sliced bamboo shoots simmered in a sweet and spicy sauce), and extra-finely chopped nori seaweed. You can also add mizuna (potherb mustard greens) or boiled eggs to taste.

title: Spicy red tsukemen (3 servings)
content:
The ramen is made with a generous amount of seafood, including dried bonito and mackerel, dried sardines, and kelp, and is finished with a special dipping sauce made with sharp soy sauce, and a complex spiciness similar to that of ramen. The noodles are made using AFURI's familiar "vacuum hand-kneaded noodles" method. Two types of domestic wheat flour and durum flour are combined, and Japanese pepper is added for a spicy kick, then kneaded in a vacuum mixer. Enjoy the chewy and springy texture that can only be achieved with high-water, hand-kneaded noodles.

The ingredients, such as the soft and tender pork slices full of collagen and the crunchy bamboo shoots seasoned with dashi, are carefully prepared to decorate the bowl. You can add green onions, mizuna (coriander also goes well with this), myoga ginger, boiled egg, etc. to your liking.
The spiciness level is about level 4 on the restaurant's level scale (0-8). If you add the extra hot chili oil that comes with the ramen, you can adjust the spiciness to level 5-6.
*Image is for illustrative purposes only.

title: AFURI Yuzu Salt Ramen (2 servings)
content:
AFURI Yuzu Shio Ramen (2 servings per box)
Click here for English explanation (Jump to English Description)
The soup is made using carefully selected ingredients to faithfully reproduce the restaurant's flavor, and the special noodles are made with a focus on texture and flavor, so you can enjoy a restaurant-like taste in the comfort of your own home.
Please try our "souvenir ramen", which is perfect as a treat for yourself or as a gift for a special person.
【noodles】 These extra-thin noodles are based on wheat flour, which has strong elasticity and stickiness and is resistant to stretching when boiled, and are made using two types of whole wheat flour with different particle sizes. This special dried noodle was created after repeated trial and error, with a unique blend that cannot be replicated anywhere else.
【soup】 We use no artificial seasonings and only carefully selected ingredients such as chicken bones, aromatic vegetables, kelp, and dried sardines to bring out the best in the ingredients. Enjoy the clear, golden soup with a deep flavor that is woven together from multiple layers of high-quality ingredients.
[Seasoning] Made with finely chopped domestic yuzu peel. Yuzu is one of AFURI's most important ingredients. We also paid special attention to the grain size and the amount per cup.
▼Contents 290g (2 servings of 75g noodles)
▼Nutritional information per serving (145g) *Estimated calorie content: 454kcal Protein 15.2g Fat 13.5g Carbohydrates 60.1g Salt equivalent: 6.1g (noodles and toppings 0.5g / soup 5.6g)

2. Put the soup provided into a bowl, add 270ml of boiling water, and mix well.
3. Once the noodles are cooked, drain them using a colander, transfer them to a bowl, and top with yuzu peel to serve.
★You can add roasted pork, boiled egg, mizuna, seaweed, etc. to your liking to make it even more delicious!

AFURI Yuzu Shio Ramen (2 servings per box)

Enjoy the authentic taste of AFURI's famous ramen at home with a soup made from carefully selected ingredients and specially crafted noodles that deliver the perfect texture and flavor.
Whether as a treat for yourself or a gift for someone special, our “Souvenir Ramen” is the perfect choice.
Noodles These thin, delicate noodles are made from two types of whole wheat flour with different textures, giving them a firm, resilient bite and resistance to overcooking. Our special dry noodles have a unique blend that you won't find anywhere else, perfected through countless trials.
Soup Without using artificial seasonings, we have carefully selected premium ingredients such as chicken bones, aromatic vegetables, kombu, and dried fish to maximize the natural power of each ingredient. Enjoy the rich and layered flavors of this golden, clear broth, crafted from the finest ingredients.
Toppings We use finely cut yuzu peel from domestic sources. Yuzu is one of AFURI's signature ingredients, and we take great care in selecting the peel's texture and portion size for each serving.
Contents 290g (75g noodles × 2 servings)
Nutritional Information (per serving: 145g)

Calories: 454kcal
Protein: 15.2g
Fat: 13.5g

Cooking Instructions

Bring a large pot of water to a boil, add the noodles, and cook to your desired firmness (loosen the noodles with chopsticks as they cook).

Firm: 2 minutes / Standard: 2 minutes 30 seconds

While the noodles are cooking, mix the included soup packet with 270ml of boiling water in a bowl.
Once the noodles are cooked, drain them and place them in the bowl with the soup. Garnish with the included yuzu peel and enjoy! Optional: Add chashu pork, boiled eggs, mizuna greens, or seaweed for an even richer experience!

title: Yuzu Karako Ramen 28th Street (3 servings)
content:
AFURI proposes a new concept of "Tasty, spicy and sour". Karakurenai's signature product is the spiciest menu item of the karakurenai ramen!

*There are nine levels of spiciness to choose from, from 0 to 8, and a new extra-hot 28th level has been introduced.

AFURI's proud chicken clear soup is seasoned with a rich, savory white soy sauce, and several types of chili powder, fresh chili puree, aromatic chili oil, etc. are used to express a deep spiciness with different characteristics of spiciness. This product, "28th Street," also uses Bhut Jolokia as an extra hot ingredient, making it a spiciness that will impress even true hotness lovers!
The sourness of the "Tasty Spicy Sour" is achieved by using freshly squeezed yuzu juice from Kochi Prefecture. The noodles are the same as those in the actual store . "Extra thin noodles with Japanese pepper" "
"With Japanese pepper" You can choose from two types: "Vacuum Hand-Kneaded Noodles" and "Vacuum Hand-Kneaded Noodles". Extra-thin noodles with "Japanese pepper": The noodles are made from wheat flour, which has a strong elasticity and stickiness and is resistant to stretching when boiled, and are cut into very thin noodles using No. 24 milling, with the addition of Hana Sansho and Japanese Sansho pepper. You can enjoy the refreshing aroma and tingling sensation of Sansho pepper as you slurp.

"With Japanese pepper" Vacuum hand-kneaded noodles: Two types of domestic wheat with different characteristics are mixed with durum flour and kneaded in a vacuum mixer. The special noodles are hand-kneaded with added Hana Sansho and Japanese Sansho pepper, giving them a refreshing tangy flavor and a smooth, chewy texture.
The ingredients, such as the soft and tender pork slices full of collagen and the crunchy bamboo shoots seasoned with dashi, are carefully prepared to decorate the bowl. Add spring onions, mizuna (cilantro also goes well with this dish), boiled eggs, etc. to taste.
*The image is for illustrative purposes only. (The product does not include boiled eggs or vegetables.)
Contents: 3 servings of homemade Sansho thin noodles (approx. 130g) or 3 servings of homemade Sansho vacuum hand-kneaded noodles (approx. 155g), 3 servings of spicy red chicken and seafood soup (approx. 380cc), 1 bag of super spicy red powder 18g, 1 bag of homemade coarsely ground chili peppers 18g, 3 bottles of freshly squeezed yuzu juice from Kochi Prefecture (15cc), 3 bags of soft and tender roast pork (60g), 3 bags of spicy bamboo shoots (20g), 3 bottles of super spicy oil (5cc)
▼Best before date If stored frozen (below -18°C), the expiration date is 180 days from the date of manufacture. Once thawed, consume on the same day.
▼Storage method: Refrigeration required
▼Allergies: Eggs, wheat, pork, chicken, soybeans, oranges, salmon, mackerel, apples
▼Other information: It usually takes about 2-3 days from order to shipping.・This item will be sent via Yamato Transport's refrigerated delivery service.・Returns/ExchangesIf there is a problem with the product, we will deal with it immediately. Please contact us by email or phone within 2 days of receiving the product.
AFURI's ramen contains no artificial seasonings, synthetic colorings or preservatives.

▼How to eat (delicious recipe included) (Preparation) Fill a bowl with boiling water to warm it up. Thaw the yuzu juice in advance under running water or in the refrigerator, then float it in the water to warm it up. 1. Boil plenty of water in a pot and heat the soup pack for about 10 minutes, the roast pork pack for 5 minutes, and the bamboo shoots for about 1 minute. 2 In another pot, bring plenty of water to a boil and add the noodles. Once the noodles have naturally loosened, use chopsticks to spread them apart and continue to boil over high heat for 1 to 1.5 minutes (2.5 to 3 minutes for vacuum-kneaded noodles with Japanese pepper) until cooked to your desired firmness. 3 Discard the water from the bowl and add 1 tablespoon (about 6g) of super spicy red powder, then pour in the soup heated in 1 and mix. Next, drain the boiled noodles thoroughly using a colander with a handle and place them in a bowl. 4 After arranging the noodles with chopsticks, top with the ingredients you heated in step 2. Shake the heated yuzu juice well and pour in 1 bottle (15cc). 5. Add some homemade coarsely ground chili pepper to taste and it's done. The "super hot oil" included in the product can be used if you feel it is not spicy enough for you. (Please note that it is very spicy.) In addition to the ingredients that come with the product, we also recommend other ingredients such as mizuna, coriander, shredded green onions, green onions, and boiled eggs.

title: Yuzuro Tsukemen (6 servings)
content:
This soup stock is made using an abundance of carefully selected ingredients, such as fresh chicken bones, aromatic vegetables, kelp, dried sardines, and dried fish (bonito flakes, dried round mullet flakes, dried mackerel flakes, etc.), and is carefully made over a long period of time and effort to condense the flavor. The AFURI-original dipping sauce is made with three types of sharp soy sauce, fish sauce, black vinegar, flavored oil, etc. to create a rich, appetizing flavor. The AFURI style is to add fragrant freshly squeezed yuzu juice from Kochi Prefecture and serve it cold (both the noodles and the dipping sauce are cold).
The noodles are made from two different types of domestic wheat with different characteristics, as well as nutritious whole wheat flour. They are kneaded in a vacuum mixer and then kneaded by hand, making them the same "vacuum hand-kneaded noodles" that are served in stores.
The ingredients are the same as those in the restaurant, including plenty of juicy braised pork, specially made bamboo shoots (thinly sliced bamboo shoots simmered in a sweet and spicy sauce), and extra-finely chopped nori seaweed. You can also add mizuna (potherb mustard greens) or boiled eggs to taste.
*50 yen cheaper per meal than the 3-meal pack. *Image is for illustrative purposes only.

title: Yuzu spicy red hotpot kit (with ramen)
content:
The ramen shop's serious hot pot set is back! The soup now contains significantly more seafood than before! It's even more delicious with a stronger dashi flavor.
AFURI's proud chicken clear soup is seasoned with a rich, savory white soy sauce, and the different spiciness of several types of chili powder, fresh chili puree, and aromatic chili oil is used to create a deep spiciness. Just before serving, add plenty of fragrant freshly squeezed yuzu juice from Kochi Prefecture to create a luxurious yuzu spicy hotpot set. The ingredients include special chicken meatballs made with fresh ground chicken and cartilage. The meatballs are kneaded with plenty of ginger, which will warm you right up.
You can also add your favorite ingredients such as seasonal vegetables, seafood, pork, and chicken to create your own original yuzu salt hotpot. Of course, you can finish off your hotpot with spicy red ramen. We provide convenient individually wrapped noodles for your convenience.
*This is a spicy hotpot. Please be careful if you are a child or if you do not like spicy food. *The photo is for illustrative purposes only. Please prepare your favorite ingredients. *1 packet of soup for 1-2 servings / 2 packets of soup for 3-4 servings
Contents: 4 packs of spicy red chicken and seafood soup (515g), 4 bottles of spicy red sauce for adjusting flavor (15g), 2 packs of spicy red powder (10g), 4 bottles of freshly squeezed yuzu juice (15cc) from Kochi Prefecture, 4 packs of special chicken meatballs (4 pieces), 4 bowls of homemade noodles (130g)

Chinese cabbage, chrysanthemum, coriander, shiitake mushrooms, shimeji mushrooms, enoki mushrooms, pork belly (for shabu-shabu), shrimp, cod fillets, scallops, shirataki, green onions. Please use other seasonal vegetables, seafood, fish paste, etc. as you like.
▼How to eat (delicious recipe included) 1 serving (double the amount for 2-3 servings) 1 Heat one packet of spicy red chicken and seafood soup in a hot water bath and dissolve it in advance. Do the same with one bottle of yuzu juice. Also, cut up the prepared ingredients (meat, seafood, vegetables, etc.) into even pieces. 2 After adding the spicy chicken and seafood soup to the pot, add 1/2 packet of spicy powder and mix well. If you are having ramen at the end of the day, leave about 100g for additional servings. 3. Add the prepared ingredients and 4 chicken meatballs to a pot and heat. 4 Once it starts to boil and the ingredients are cooked, pour the yuzu juice (from one citrus fruit) over the entire pot and it's done. Enjoy! Add the soup that you left over from step 2 of the final ramen to the pot. If the amount of soup seems small, add hot water until the noodles are swimming in it. Turn the heat to high, and when the pot is boiling, add one frozen ball of noodles and cover. When steam starts to rise, remove the lid and adjust the heat to boil for 1.5 to 2 minutes (4 to 4.5 minutes for medium-thick noodles) until the noodles are cooked to your desired firmness. After that, adjust the flavor with the included flavor adjustment sauce, and finish by adding yuzu juice to create an even more fragrant ramen. ※One extra step※ You can either parboil the noodles before using, or thaw them in the refrigerator and rinse them under running water before adding them to the pot, allowing you to finish the soup without thickening it. You can also make your own porridge with the soup left over after the ramen. I recommend adding green onions and mitsuba and topping it off with beaten eggs. Please give it a try.

title: Salt-flavored ramen (3 servings)
content:
The lifeblood of AFURI's ramen is its golden soup. Carefully selected ingredients such as fresh chicken carcasses, whole chickens, aromatic vegetables, kelp, and dried sardines are simmered in pure, soft water that is perfect for preparation. The special salt sauce is a blend of seasonings such as Guérande salt from Brittany, France, seaweed salt from the Seto Inland Sea, and white tamari salt that is brewed in wooden barrels and naturally fermented. The combination of these ingredients creates a soup with a deep, umami flavor.
As with AFURI physical stores, you can choose from two types of noodles: "extra thin noodles made with whole wheat flour" and "vacuum hand-kneaded noodles." Extra thin whole wheat noodles: The original recipe is based on wheat flour, which has strong elasticity and stickiness and is resistant to stretching when boiled, and two types of whole wheat flour with different grain sizes, plus rye. Homemade noodles made using a No. 24 cutting blade.
Vacuum hand-kneaded noodles: In addition to two types of domestic wheat with different characteristics, nutritious whole wheat flour is mixed and kneaded in a vacuum mixer, then hand-kneaded to give it a smooth and chewy texture.
Contents: 3 servings of homemade extra-thin whole wheat noodles (approx. 130g) or 3 servings of vacuum-kneaded noodles (approx. 155g) Chicken and seafood soup (approx. 360cc)

title: Whole wheat extra thin noodles (6 servings)
content:
The basic ramen noodles used in AFURI's brick-and-mortar stores are homemade. The original mix is based on wheat flour, which has a strong elasticity and stickiness and is resistant to stretching when boiled, with two types of whole wheat flour with different grain sizes and rye added. Enjoy the exquisite sipping experience and the aroma of wheat that lingers in your nose.

title: AFURI Yuzu Shio Ramen (2 servings) x 10 boxes Free shipping
content:
AFURI Yuzu Shio Ramen (2 servings per box) x 10 boxes
Click here for English explanation (Jump to English Description)
The soup is made using carefully selected ingredients to faithfully reproduce the restaurant's flavor, and the special noodles are made with a focus on texture and flavor, so you can enjoy a restaurant-like taste in the comfort of your own home.
Please try our "souvenir ramen", which is perfect as a treat for yourself or as a gift for a special person.
【noodles】 These extra-thin noodles are based on wheat flour, which has strong elasticity and stickiness and is resistant to stretching when boiled, and are made using two types of whole wheat flour with different particle sizes. This special dried noodle was created after repeated trial and error, with a unique blend that cannot be found anywhere else.
【soup】 We use no artificial seasonings and only carefully selected ingredients such as chicken bones, aromatic vegetables, kelp, and dried sardines to bring out the best in the ingredients. Enjoy the clear, golden soup with a deep flavor that is woven together from multiple layers of high-quality ingredients.
[Seasoning] Made with finely chopped domestic yuzu peel. Yuzu is one of AFURI's most important ingredients. We also paid special attention to the grain size and the amount per cup.

Enjoy the authentic taste of AFURI's famous ramen at home with a soup made from carefully selected ingredients and specially crafted noodles that deliver the perfect texture and flavor.
Whether as a treat for yourself or a gift for someone special, our “Souvenir Ramen” is the perfect choice.
Noodles These thin, delicate noodles are made from two types of whole wheat flour with different textures, giving them a firm, resilient bite and resistance to overcooking. Our special dry noodles have a unique blend that you won't find anywhere else, perfected through countless trials.
Soup Without using artificial seasonings, we have carefully selected premium ingredients such as chicken bones, aromatic vegetables, kombu, and dried fish to maximize the natural power of each ingredient. Enjoy the rich and layered flavors of this golden, clear broth, crafted from the finest ingredients.
Toppings We use finely cut yuzu peel from domestic sources. Yuzu is one of AFURI's signature ingredients, and we take great care in selecting the peel's texture and portion size for each serving.

title: Yuzu soy sauce hotpot kit (with ramen)
content:
The ramen shop's serious hot pot set is back! The soup now contains significantly more seafood than before! It's even more delicious with a stronger dashi flavor.
This chicken and seafood soup is made by combining AFURI's proud chicken clear broth with a large amount of seafood (dried sardines, bonito flakes, grilled flying fish, kelp, etc.) and seasoning it with a special soy sauce sauce. By adding fragrant freshly squeezed yuzu juice from Kochi Prefecture, an elegant aroma is created, allowing you to enjoy a luxurious yuzu soy sauce hot pot.
The special chicken meatballs are made with fresh ground chicken and cartilage, and are kneaded with plenty of ginger, which will warm you right up.
You can also add your favorite ingredients such as seasonal vegetables, seafood, pork, and chicken to create your own original yuzu soy sauce hot pot. Of course, you can finish off your hot pot with yuzu soy sauce ramen. We provide convenient individually wrapped noodles for your convenience.
*The photo is for illustrative purposes only. Please prepare your favorite ingredients. *1 packet of soup for 1-2 servings / 2 packets of soup for 3-4 servings
Contents: 4 packs of chicken and seafood soup (515g), 4 bottles of soy sauce for adjusting flavor (15g), 4 bottles of freshly squeezed yuzu juice from Kochi Prefecture (15cc), 4 packs of special chicken meatballs (4 pieces), 4 bowls of homemade noodles (130g)
▼Best before date If stored frozen (below -18°C), the expiration date is 180 days from the date of manufacture. Once thawed, consume on the same day.

It goes well with a wide range of ingredients, including Chinese cabbage, chrysanthemum, mizuna, shiitake mushrooms, shimeji mushrooms, enoki mushrooms, pork belly (for shabu-shabu), chicken thighs, shirataki, and green onions. It also goes well with a wide range of other ingredients, including seasonal vegetables, seafood, and fish paste.
▼How to eat (delicious recipe included) 1 serving (double the amount for 2-3 servings) 1 Heat one packet of chicken and seafood soup in a hot water bath or similar and dissolve it in advance. Do the same with one bottle of yuzu juice. Also, cut up the prepared ingredients (meat, seafood, vegetables, etc.) into even pieces. 2 Add the chicken and seafood soup to the pot. If you are having this ramen as a final dish, leave about 100g aside for later. 3. Add the prepared ingredients and 4 chicken meatballs to a pot and heat. 4 Once it starts to boil and the ingredients are cooked, pour the yuzu juice (from one citrus fruit) over the entire pot and it's done. Enjoy! Add the soup that you left over from step 2 of the final ramen to the pot. If the amount of soup seems small, add hot water until the noodles are swimming in it. Turn the heat to high, and when the pot is boiling, add one frozen ball of noodles and cover. When steam starts to rise, remove the lid and adjust the heat to boil for 1.5 to 2 minutes (4 to 4.5 minutes for medium-thick noodles) until the noodles are cooked to your desired firmness. After that, adjust the flavor with the included flavor adjustment sauce, and finish by adding yuzu juice to create an even more fragrant ramen. ※One extra step※ You can either parboil the noodles before using, or thaw them in the refrigerator and rinse them under running water before adding them to the pot, allowing you to finish the soup without thickening it. You can also make your own porridge with the soup left over after the ramen. I recommend adding green onions and mitsuba and topping it off with beaten eggs. Please give it a try.

title: 3 bags of plump roast pork (approx. 180g)
content:
<3 bags of char siu pork (approx. 180g)>
This product is part of AFURI's second concept, Karakurenai, which offers "delicious, spicy and sour" ramen and tsukemen.
Fresh pork belly with cartilage is boiled in a large pressure cooker for about 3 hours until the cartilage becomes soft and tender. The dish is seasoned with a special sauce made from aromatic vegetables such as ginger and green onions, tamari soy sauce, honey, yuzu jam, orange juice, etc.
Because it is soft and juicy, you might mistakenly think it is greasy, but in fact it contains very little oil. (It melts during cooking.) The transparent part inside is cartilage that has melted under high heat. In other words, it is collagen.
It's so soft that it melts in your mouth, and the sweet and spicy flavor goes perfectly with spicy soup! You can also put it on rice as in the example in the photo and enjoy it as your own original char siu rice bowl.
*The photos of the rice/ramen are for illustrative purposes only.
▼Contents: 3 bags of soft and tender roast pork (approx. 60g each)
▼How to eat: If heating in a water bath, place the bag in boiling water and heat for 4 to 5 minutes.
- If using a microwave, transfer to a plate, cover with plastic wrap, and heat for 40 seconds to 1 minute. (This may vary slightly depending on the capacity of your microwave oven.)

title: Yuzu Karakuri Ramen (6 servings)
content:
Spicy level 4 (0-8)

AFUR I proposes a new concept of "Tasty, spicy and sour." Karakurenai's signature product has arrived.
AFURI's proud chicken clear broth is seasoned with a richly flavored white soy sauce, and various types of chili powder, fresh chili puree, and aromatic chili oil are used to create a deep spiciness with different characteristics. Freshly squeezed yuzu juice from Kochi Prefecture is used to add a sour taste to the "Tasty Spicy Sour" dish.
The noodles are the same as in the actual store . "Extra thin noodles with Japanese pepper" "
"With Japanese pepper" You can choose from two types: "vacuum hand-kneaded noodles" and "noodles with a simmered sauce." Extra-thin noodles with "sansho pepper": These noodles are made from wheat flour, which has a strong elasticity and stickiness and is resistant to stretching when boiled, and are cut into extra-thin noodles using No. 24 threads, with the addition of Japanese pepper and Japanese sansho pepper. You can enjoy the refreshing aroma and tingling sensation of the sansho pepper as you slurp.


"With Japanese pepper" Vacuum hand-kneaded noodles: Two types of domestic wheat with different characteristics are mixed with durum flour and kneaded in a vacuum mixer. The special noodles are hand-kneaded with added Hana Sansho pepper and Japanese Sansho pepper, and are characterized by their refreshing tangy flavor and smooth, chewy texture. *If you select "Mix," we will provide you with three servings of each of the two types of noodles mentioned above.
The bowl is decorated with ingredients that have been painstakingly prepared, such as soft and tender pork slices that are rich in collagen, and crunchy bamboo shoots seasoned with dashi. Add green onions, mizuna (coriander also goes well with this dish), boiled eggs, etc. to your liking.
The spiciness level is about level 4 on a scale of 0 to 8. If you add the extra spicy chili oil that comes with the dish, you can adjust the spiciness to about level 5 or 6.
*50 yen cheaper per meal than the 3-meal pack. *The image is for illustrative purposes only. (The product does not include boiled eggs or vegetables.)

→ Added " Spicy Adjustment Kit (with bonus) " sold separately!!

▼How to eat (delicious recipe included) (Preparation) Fill a bowl with boiling water to warm it up. Thaw the yuzu juice in advance under running water or in the refrigerator, then float it in the water and warm it up. 1. Boil plenty of water in a pot and heat the soup pack for about 10 minutes, the char siu pack for 5 minutes, and the bamboo shoots for about 1 minute. 2 Bring a large amount of water to a boil in another pot and add the noodles. Once the noodles have loosened up naturally, spread them out with chopsticks and continue boiling over high heat for 1 to 1.5 minutes (2.5 to 3 minutes for vacuum-kneaded noodles with sansho pepper) until they are cooked to your desired firmness. 3. Discard the water from the heated bowl and add 1 tablespoon (approximately 6g) of spicy red powder. Then pour in the soup heated in step 1 and mix. Next, drain the boiled noodles thoroughly using a strainer with a handle and add them to the bowl. 4 After arranging the noodles with chopsticks, top with the ingredients you heated in Step 2. Shake the heated yuzu juice well and pour in one bottle (15cc). Finally, add some spicy chili oil to taste and it's done. In addition to the ingredients that come with it, we recommend mizuna, cilantro, shredded scallions, green onions, and boiled eggs.

title: [Limited Edition] Meat Assortment DX
content:
The extremely popular deluxe set has been further improved!! In addition to the five most popular types of meat products (prepared dishes) carefully made by AFURI, a special set of roasted duck is now available for a limited time only!
The duck meat is carefully prepared, seasoned simply with seaweed salt and black pepper, and then baked and vacuum-cooked at low temperature to create roast duck. The luxurious flavor is perfect for entertaining on special occasions. Please enjoy the moist and tender duck meat.
All the pieces are individually wrapped, so you can eat as much as you need, when you need it. It's great for a luxurious assortment for the family, or as a side dish for one or two people with alcohol.
A deluxe meat platter that will add a fun and delicious touch to your time at home. Please give it a try.
*The photo is for illustrative purposes only. Please prepare condiments such as spring onions and mizuna separately. *We recommend pairing this with the "All-Purpose Spicy Miso (Yuzu Spicy Red Sauce)" sold separately.

Thaw it in the refrigerator, or if you are in a hurry, thaw it under running water, then slice it thinly with a sharp knife and enjoy.

title: [Special Sale] Comparison of Yuzu Salt and Yuzu Soy Sauce Ramen (4 servings)
content:
Thank you for visiting! This product is AFURI's two representative ramens are "Yuzu Shio Ramen" and "Yuzu Shoyu Ramen". This set comes with two servings of each of these two types so you can compare them. It is especially recommended for first-time customers! *This is a limited product for customers who access the special page. Please note that purchases can only be made on this page. For details on the Yuzu Shio Ramen and Yuzu Soy Sauce Ramen, please check the respective pages . All of these products are made with the goal of recreating the taste of the restaurant at home. Try them all and compare them to find your favorite. The noodles are Just like in the AFURI physical store, "whole wheat extra thin noodles" You can choose from two types of "vacuum hand-kneaded noodles". Extra thin whole wheat noodles: This original recipe is based on wheat flour, which has strong elasticity and stickiness and is resistant to stretching when boiled, and contains two types of whole wheat flour with different grain sizes, as well as rye. Homemade noodles. Vacuum hand-kneaded noodles: In addition to two types of domestic wheat with different characteristics, nutritious whole wheat flour is mixed and kneaded in a vacuum mixer, then hand-kneaded to give it a smooth and chewy texture. *If you select "Mix," we will provide you with two servings of each of the two types of noodles mentioned above (whole wheat extra thin noodles and vacuum hand-kneaded noodles).
The ingredients include thick and juicy roasted pork, specially made bamboo shoots (thinly sliced bamboo shoots simmered in a sweet and spicy sauce), and premium nori sheets. If you like, you can top it with mizuna (Japanese mustard greens) or a boiled egg to make it even more delicious. title: 6 bags of Pork Fillet Char Siu (approx. 360g)
content:
<6 bags of char siu pork (approx. 360g)>
This product is part of AFURI's second concept, Karakurenai, which offers "delicious, spicy and sour" ramen and tsukemen.
Fresh pork belly with cartilage is boiled in a large pressure cooker for about 3 hours until the cartilage becomes soft and tender. The dish is seasoned with a special sauce made from aromatic vegetables such as ginger and green onions, tamari soy sauce, honey, yuzu jam, orange juice, etc.
Because it is soft and juicy, you might mistakenly think it is greasy, but in fact it contains very little oil. (It melts during cooking.) The transparent part inside is cartilage that has melted under high heat. In other words, it is collagen.
It's so soft that it melts in your mouth, and the sweet and spicy flavor goes perfectly with spicy soup! You can also put it on rice as in the example in the photo and enjoy it as your own original char siu rice bowl.
*The photos of the rice/ramen are for illustrative purposes only.

title: Special Chicken Char Siu 3 pieces (approx. 690g)
content:
This moist and juicy chicken char siu is popular at all AFURI stores. Excess fat is removed from fresh branded chicken breast meat, which is then soaked overnight in a special pickling liquid before being vacuum-cooked at low temperature. The pickling liquid contains seaweed salt, fish sauce, wine, and various herbs. This dish is made with exquisite seasoning and temperature control, showcasing the artisan's skill.
Not only can it be used as an additional ingredient for ramen, but it can also be enjoyed as a snack or in a salad! It is a good source of protein, so it is perfect for those who are dieting or bulking up.

title: AFURI Yuzu Shio Ramen (2 servings) [Cannot be bundled]
content:
AFURI Yuzu Shio Ramen (2 servings per box)
Click here for English explanation (Jump to English Description)
The soup is made using carefully selected ingredients to faithfully reproduce the restaurant's flavor, and the special noodles are made with a focus on texture and flavor, so you can enjoy a restaurant-like taste in the comfort of your own home.
Please try our "souvenir ramen", which is perfect as a treat for yourself or as a gift for a special person.
【noodles】 These extra-thin noodles are based on wheat flour, which has strong elasticity and stickiness and is resistant to stretching when boiled, and are made using two types of whole wheat flour with different particle sizes. This special dried noodle was created after repeated trial and error, with a unique blend that cannot be found anywhere else.
【soup】 We use no artificial seasonings and only carefully selected ingredients such as chicken bones, aromatic vegetables, kelp, and dried sardines to bring out the best in the ingredients. Enjoy the clear, golden soup with a deep flavor that is woven together from multiple layers of high-quality ingredients.
[Seasoning] Made with finely chopped domestic yuzu peel. Yuzu is one of AFURI's most important ingredients. We also paid special attention to the grain size and the amount per cup.
▼Contents 290g (2 servings of 75g noodles)
▼Nutritional information per serving (145g) *Estimated calorie content: 454kcal Protein 15.2g Fat 13.5g Carbohydrates 60.1g Salt equivalent: 6.1g (noodles and toppings 0.5g / soup 5.6g)
▼Allergen information: Wheat, sesame, salmon, mackerel, soybeans, chicken, pork
▼Best before date At the time of ordering, we will deliver products with a best before date of at least 2 months. *We cannot accommodate requests to specify an expiration date when placing an order.
▼Storage method: Store at room temperature away from direct sunlight, high temperatures and humidity. Once opened, please consume as soon as possible regardless of the expiration date.
▼Size/dimensions (2 meals per box) Height: Approx. 250mm Depth: Approx. 35mm Width: Approx. 85mm
▼How to make delicious ramen1Put plenty of water in a pot and put it on the fire. When it boils, add the noodles and boil them to your desired hardness. (You can loosen the noodles with chopsticks halfway through.) Hard: 2 minutes / Basic: 2 minutes 30 seconds
2. Put the soup provided into a bowl, add 270ml of boiling water, and mix well.
3. Once the noodles are cooked, drain them using a colander, transfer to a bowl, and top with yuzu peel to serve.
★You can add roasted pork, boiled egg, mizuna, seaweed, etc. to your liking to make it even more delicious!
▼ Regarding shipping, packaging size will vary depending on the number of items ordered. (It will be shipped by Yamato Transport Takkyubin or Compact.) Shipping costs are a flat rate of 1,000 yen ( free shipping for purchases of 7 or more ). *This product cannot be purchased at the same time as Cool Takkyubin products.

AFURI Yuzu Shio Ramen (2 servings per box)

Enjoy the authentic taste of AFURI's famous ramen at home with a soup made from carefully selected ingredients and specially crafted noodles that deliver the perfect texture and flavor.
Whether as a treat for yourself or a gift for someone special, our “Souvenir Ramen” is the perfect choice.
Noodles These thin, delicate noodles are made from two types of whole wheat flour with different textures, giving them a firm, resilient bite and resistance to overcooking. Our special dry noodles have a unique blend that you won't find anywhere else, perfected through countless trials.
Soup Without using artificial seasonings, we have carefully selected premium ingredients such as chicken bones, aromatic vegetables, kombu, and dried fish to maximize the natural power of each ingredient. Enjoy the rich and layered flavors of this golden, clear broth, crafted from the finest ingredients.
Toppings We use finely cut yuzu peel from domestic sources. Yuzu is one of AFURI's signature ingredients, and we take great care in selecting the peel's texture and portion size for each serving.
Contents 290g (75g noodles × 2 servings)
Nutritional Information (per serving: 145g)

Calories: 454kcal
Protein: 15.2g
Fat: 13.5g
Carbohydrates: 60.1g
Salt: 6.1g (Noodles & toppings: 0.5g / Soup: 5.6g)

Allergen Information Contains wheat, sesame, salmon, mackerel, soy, chicken, pork.
Expiration Date We guarantee at least 2 months before the expiration date at the time of your order. Please note we cannot accommodate requests for specific expiration dates.
Storage Instructions Store at room temperature, away from direct sunlight and high humidity. Please consume promptly after opening, regardless of the expiration date.
Dimensions (2 servings per box) Height: approx. 250mm Depth: approx. 35mm Width: approx. 85mm
Cooking Instructions

Bring a large pot of water to a boil, add the noodles, and cook to your desired firmness (loosen the noodles with chopsticks as they cook).

Firm: 2 minutes / Standard: 2 minutes 30 seconds

While the noodles are cooking, mix the included soup packet with 270ml of boiling water in a bowl.
Once the noodles are cooked, drain them and place them in the bowl with the soup. Garnish with the included yuzu peel and enjoy! Optional: Add chashu pork, boiled eggs, mizuna greens, or seaweed for an even richer experience!

Shipping Information The package size will vary depending on the number of items ordered. (We ship via Yamato courier or compact delivery.) A flat shipping fee of 1,000 yen applies (free shipping for orders of 7 or more boxes). This product cannot be purchased alongside items shipped via refrigerated delivery.

title: Kararo Tsukemen (6 servings)
content:
This soup stock is made using an abundance of carefully selected ingredients, such as fresh chicken bones, aromatic vegetables, kelp, dried sardines, and dried fish (bonito flakes, dried round mullet flakes, dried mackerel flakes, etc.), and is carefully made over a long period of time and effort to condense the flavor. The AFURI-original dipping sauce is made with three types of sharp soy sauce, fish sauce, black vinegar, and aromatic oils to create a rich, appetizing flavor. The AFURI style is to add homemade chili oil made with fragrant sesame oil and serve it cold (both the noodles and the dipping sauce are cold).
The noodles are made from two different types of domestic wheat with different characteristics, as well as nutritious whole wheat flour. They are kneaded in a vacuum mixer and then kneaded by hand, making them the same "vacuum hand-kneaded noodles" that are served in stores.
The ingredients are the same as those in the restaurant, including plenty of juicy braised pork, specially made bamboo shoots (thinly sliced bamboo shoots simmered in a sweet and spicy sauce), and extra-finely chopped nori seaweed. You can also add mizuna (potherb mustard greens) or boiled eggs to taste.
*50 yen cheaper per meal than the 3-meal pack. *Image is for illustrative purposes only.
Contents: 6 servings of homemade vacuum-kneaded noodles (approx. 155g), 6 servings of seafood soy sauce dipping sauce with chili oil (approx. 160g), 2 bags of special dipping sauce toppings (approx. 10g), 2 bags of delicious spicy chili powder (approx. 10g), 6 bags of special braised pork fillets (approx. 70g), 6 bags of bamboo shoots (approx. 20g), 6 bags of premium chopped seaweed, 6 bags of special soup stock
▼Best before date If stored frozen (below -18°C), the expiration date is 180 days from the date of manufacture. Once thawed, consume on the same day.
▼Storage method: Refrigeration required
▼Allergies: Eggs, wheat, pork, chicken, soybeans, mackerel, sesame

▼How to eat (delicious recipe included) ← Recommended! 1) Thaw the dipping sauce under running water (about 10 minutes). This will go faster if you rub it lightly halfway through. 2 Heat the braised pork and bamboo shoots in a hot water bath for about 3 minutes. (You can also transfer them to a container and use the microwave.) 3Boil the noodles in plenty of water. ※On high heat 4 minutes 30 seconds to 5 minutes 30 seconds 4. Pour the dipping sauce into a bowl and add 1 teaspoon of toppings. 5. Rinse the noodles under running water to remove any slime and drain. 6. Place the noodles in a bowl, sprinkle with spicy chili powder, add the toppings and it's done! In addition to the ingredients that come with it, we also recommend mizuna, boiled eggs, and chopped green onions. Heat the dipping sauce made in step 1 in a boiling water bath for about 5 minutes. Cook the noodles over high heat in step 3. After boiling for 4 to 4.5 minutes , Rinse under running water to remove the slime, then return to the boiling water and heat for 10 seconds before serving. *If you sprinkle a little vegetable oil that you have at home on the noodles, they will not stick together easily.
ingredients: are the same as those in the restaurant, including plenty of juicy braised pork, specially made bamboo shoots (thinly sliced ​​bamboo shoots simmered in a sweet and spicy sauce), and extra-finely chopped nori seaweed. You can also add mizuna (potherb mustard greens) or boiled eggs to taste.

title: 2 x Super Spicy Chili Oil
content:
This product is made by finely grinding the by-products (chili pepper powder, fried onions, and garlic) that are produced when making super spicy chili oil and mixing them into the chili oil. Enjoy the mellow aroma of burnt herbs and the stimulating spiciness.
Not only can it be used to add spiciness to ramen, but it can also be used in a variety of dishes, including gyoza, stir-fried vegetables, grilled meat, miso soup, and instant noodles. It's also perfect as a spiciness for our popular hot pot products (Yuzu Shio Nabe / Spicy Red Nabe Kit)! This pack contains two generous 90g bottles (about three times the amount of a regular small bottle).

title: Ramen soup (salt)
content:
The lifeblood of AFURI's ramen is its golden soup. Carefully selected ingredients such as fresh chicken carcasses, whole chickens, aromatic vegetables, kelp, and dried sardines are simmered in pure, soft water that is perfect for preparation. The special salt sauce is a blend of seasonings such as Guérande salt from Brittany, France, seaweed salt from the Seto Inland Sea, and white tamari salt that is brewed in wooden barrels and naturally fermented. The combination of these ingredients creates a soup with a deep, umami flavor. It can also be used as additional soup for various AFURI hot pot products! \You can also enjoy recipe variations!/ You can also enjoy it as rice porridge by pouring rice and beaten eggs into the soup and simmering it in a pot. Serve with spring onions or chicken char siu, if desired. Please use it for various other recipes. We look forward to your recommended recipes in the reviews!!
*The image is for illustrative purposes only. Noodles and toppings are not included.

AFURI Yuzu Shio Ramen (2 servings per box) x 20 boxes

Enjoy the authentic taste of AFURI's famous ramen at home with a soup made from carefully selected ingredients and specially crafted noodles that deliver the perfect texture and flavor.
Whether as a treat for yourself or a gift for someone special, our “Souvenir Ramen” is the perfect choice.
Noodles These thin, delicate noodles are made from two types of whole wheat flour with different textures, giving them a firm, resilient bite and resistance to overcooking. Our special dry noodles have a unique blend that you won't find anywhere else, perfected through countless trials.
Soup Without using artificial seasonings, we have carefully selected premium ingredients such as chicken bones, aromatic vegetables, kombu, and dried fish to maximize the natural power of each ingredient. Enjoy the rich and layered flavors of this golden, clear broth, crafted from the finest ingredients.
Toppings We use finely cut yuzu peel from domestic sources. Yuzu is one of AFURI's signature ingredients, and we take great care in selecting the peel's texture and portion size for each serving.
